archdesc.bioghist: Thomas Erle Hadley of Holly, Mich., was an architectural engineer, inventor, and poet. With his wife Arlene Hadley he created and distributed nature films.
archdesc.scopecontent: Seven nature films made by Thomas and Arlene Hadley: "Evangeline Adventure Trails," "Happy Valley" (on 2 reels with separate sound track), "Into the North Woods" (with separate sound track), "Nature Trails of North America," "America the Beautiful" (on 2 reels with separate sound track), "Hiawatha Songs of Nature" (or "Song of Hiawatha," with separate sound track), and "Eskimo Summer in Alaska" (Betacam, VHS, and DVD copies), with background information and shot lists for these and other films. Also one book by Hadley, "Happy Valley: Poetic Interpretations of Nature."
